verses.verse: Knowest <S%H3045><s%> thou the time <S%H6256><s%> when the wild goats <S%H3277><s%> of the rock <S%H5553><s%> bring forth <S%H3205><s%>? Or canst thou mark <S%H8104><s%> when the hinds <S%H355><s%> do calve <S%H2342><s%>?
Canst thou number <S%H5608><s%> the months <S%H3391><s%> that they fulfil <S%H4390><s%>? Or knowest <S%H3045><s%> thou the time <S%H6256><s%> when they bring forth <S%H3205><s%>?
They bow <S%H3766><s%> themselves <S%H6398><s%>, they bring forth their young <S%H3206><s%>, They cast out <S%H7971><s%> their pains <S%H2256><s%>.
Their young ones <S%H1121><s%> become strong <S%H2492><s%>, they grow up <S%H7235><s%> in the open field <S%H1250><s%>; They go forth <S%H3318><s%>, and return not again <S%H7725><s%>.
Who hath sent out <S%H7971><s%> the wild ass <S%H6501><s%> free <S%H2670><s%>? Or who hath loosed <S%H6605><s%> the bonds <S%H4147><s%> of the swift ass <S%H6171><s%>,
Whose home <S%H1004><s%> I have made <S%H7760><s%> the wilderness <S%H6160><s%>, And the salt <S%H4420><s%> land his dwelling-place <S%H4908><s%>?
He scorneth <S%H7832><s%> the tumult <S%H1995><s%> of the city <S%H7151><s%>, Neither heareth <S%H8085><s%> he the shoutings <S%H8663><s%> of the driver <S%H5065><s%>.
The range <S%H3491><s%> of the mountains <S%H2022><s%> is his pasture <S%H4829><s%>, And he searcheth <S%H1875><s%> after <S%H310><s%> every green thing <S%H3387><s%>.
Will the wild-ox <S%H7214><s%> be content <S%H14><s%> to serve <S%H5647><s%> thee <S%H3885><s%>? Or will he abide by thy crib <S%H18><s%>?
Canst thou bind <S%H7194><s%> the wild-ox <S%H7214><s%> with his band <S%H5688><s%> in the furrow <S%H8525><s%>? Or will he harrow <S%H7702><s%> the valleys <S%H6010><s%> after thee <S%H310><s%>?
Wilt thou trust <S%H982><s%> him <S%H3581><s%>, because his strength is great <S%H7227><s%>? Or wilt thou leave <S%H5800><s%> to him thy labor <S%H3018><s%>?
Wilt thou confide <S%H539><s%> in him <S%H7725><s%>, that he will bring home thy seed <S%H2233><s%>, And gather <S%H622><s%> the grain of thy threshing-floor <S%H1637><s%>?
The wings <S%H3671><s%> of the ostrich <S%H5965><s%> wave proudly <S%H7443><s%>; But are they the pinions <S%H84><s%> and plumage <S%H2624><s%> of love <S%H5133><s%>?
For she leaveth <S%H5800><s%> her eggs <S%H1000><s%> on the earth <S%H776><s%>, And warmeth <S%H2552><s%> them in the dust <S%H6083><s%>,
And forgetteth <S%H7911><s%> that the foot <S%H7272><s%> may crush <S%H2115><s%> them <S%H7704><s%>, Or that the wild beast <S%H2416><s%> may trample them <S%H1758><s%>.
She dealeth hardly <S%H7188><s%> with her young ones <S%H1121><s%>, as if they were not <S%H3808><s%> hers <S%H3018><s%>: Though her labor be in vain <S%H7385><s%>, she is without fear <S%H6343><s%>;
Because God <S%H433><s%> hath deprived <S%H5382><s%> her of wisdom <S%H2451><s%>, Neither hath he imparted <S%H2505><s%> to her understanding <S%H998><s%>.
What time <S%H6256><s%> she lifteth up <S%H4754><s%> herself on high <S%H4791><s%>, She scorneth <S%H7832><s%> the horse <S%H5483><s%> and his rider <S%H7392><s%>.
Hast thou given <S%H5414><s%> the horse <S%H5483><s%> his might <S%H1369><s%>? Hast thou clothed <S%H3847><s%> his neck <S%H6677><s%> with the quivering mane <S%H7483><s%>?
Hast thou made him to leap <S%H7493><s%> as a locust <S%H697><s%>? The glory <S%H1935><s%> of his snorting <S%H5170><s%> is terrible <S%H367><s%>.
He paweth <S%H2658><s%> in the valley <S%H6010><s%>, and rejoiceth <S%H7797><s%> in his strength <S%H3581><s%>: He goeth out <S%H3318><s%> to meet <S%H7125><s%> the armed men <S%H5402><s%>.
He mocketh <S%H7832><s%> at fear <S%H6343><s%>, and is not dismayed <S%H2865><s%>; Neither turneth he back <S%H7725><s%> from <S%H6440><s%> the sword <S%H2719><s%>.
The quiver <S%H827><s%> rattleth <S%H7439><s%> against him <S%H3851><s%>, The flashing spear <S%H2595><s%> and the javelin <S%H3591><s%>.

He swalloweth <S%H1572><s%> the ground <S%H776><s%> with fierceness <S%H7494><s%> and rage <S%H7267><s%>; Neither believeth <S%H539><s%> he that it is the voice <S%H6963><s%> of the trumpet <S%H7782><s%>.

As oft as the trumpet <S%H7782><s%> soundeth <S%H1767><s%> he saith <S%H559><s%>, Aha <S%H1889><s%>! <S%H1889><s%> And he smelleth <S%H7306><s%> the battle <S%H4421><s%> afar off <S%H7350><s%>, The thunder <S%H7482><s%> of the captains <S%H8269><s%>, and the shouting <S%H8643><s%>.
Is it by thy wisdom <S%H998><s%> that the hawk <S%H5322><s%> soareth <S%H82><s%>, (And <S%H6566><s%>) stretcheth her wings <S%H3671><s%> toward the south <S%H8486><s%>?
Is it at thy command <S%H6310><s%> that the eagle <S%H5404><s%> mounteth up <S%H1361><s%>, And maketh <S%H7311><s%> her nest <S%H7064><s%> on high <S%H7311><s%>?
On the cliff <S%H5553><s%> she dwelleth <S%H7931><s%>, and maketh her home <S%H3885><s%>, Upon the point <S%H5553><s%> of the cliff <S%H8127><s%>, and the stronghold <S%H4686><s%>.
From thence she spieth <S%H2658><s%> out the prey <S%H400><s%>; Her eyes <S%H5869><s%> behold <S%H5027><s%> it afar off <S%H7350><s%>.
Her young ones <S%H667><s%> also suck up <S%H5966><s%> blood <S%H1818><s%>: And where the slain <S%H2491><s%> are <S%H1931><s%>, there is she.
